STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 26, 2023
Kimberlee Lefear
Genesee County DHHS
125 E. Union St.
Flint, MI. 48502-2036
Re: License #: CP250201139
Dear Ms. Lefear:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
6/6/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 248-860-0787.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

Services

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
FOM 722 – O8D Treatment plans Agreement and Signature:
Once completed and approved, the caseworker
Must obtain signatures from the following
Individuals, as applicable:
• Foster parents, relative caregivers, and
Unrelated court ordered caregivers.
Six foster care files and twenty - three PATP’s were reviewed. Five of twenty – three PATP’s
reviewed documented late/missing signatures or boxes not being checked indicating
participation.
One case file report dated 8/23/22 – 11/20/22 was missing the signature by the parent.
Second case file report dated 2/23/22 – 5/23/22, PATP was signed on 6/29/23. Same case
file report dated 8/22/22 – 11/18/22, the parent signed the report on 1/19/23 and there was
no foster parent signature.
Third case file report dated 9/13/22 – 12/9/22 was signed on 1/19/23. Same case file report
dated 12/10/22 – 3/9/23, boxes not checked.
Fourth case file report dated 10/17/22 – 11/15/22 was signed on 1/11/23.
Fifth case file report dated 7/26/22 – 10/21/22, no signatures on the PATP. Same case file
report dated 10/22/22 – 1/19/22, PATP was missing, and report dated 1/20/23 - 4/19/23,
boxes was not checked, and date of signature was missing.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL DATED 4/8/22; CAP APPROVED
4/18/2022.
2

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation provided.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. Renewal
Inspection dated 4/8/2022, CAP accepted 4/18/2022 was in violation with Rules
400.12418 (2,a) and 400.12418 (2,b) Development of service plans, 400.12510 (2)
Independent living contract, 400.12511 Termination, and policy/contract, ISEP
4.22 MiSACWIS, FOM DHHS Policy 722.08D. The agency has worked really well
with their CAP as for this reporting period, they only have one repeat violation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed in the entrance
conference. The Chief Administrator identified areas of non-compliance involving
timely completion of documentation due to worker/supervisor changes. She
identified work restriction associated with the ongoing pandemic, face to face with
clients, access to work onsite equipment, system related concerns, printing,
scanning, uploading along with staff turnover. She reported overall, things are
getting much better.
Financial Overview
A financial audit was not required as this licensee is an MDHHS office.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The staff interviewed all reported that there have been a lot of
staffing/supervisory/administrative changes over the past year. They report that
they do get good support and feel encouraged with the recent changes. All of the
staff love their current positions and helping families. The only barrier they have is
3

they would change the amount of paperwork they have to do and devote that time
to helping families more.
There were no youth interviews.
Description of Agency Walk Through
No safety issues were noted. The office has sufficient space for staff and storage
of files.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert: Concern: The family has a bed assembled in the
recreational area of the basement and there is no means of egress. There is no
smoke detector located in the basement or properly placed near the bedroom that is
designated for the ten-year-old youth bedroom. Resolution: Caseworker visited the
home and verified the smoke detector in the upstairs area was working but the one
in the basement was not due to needing a battery. A battery was put in the smoke
detector while the worker was onsite. A conversation was held with the caregiver on
3/27/23 about the safety of the bed in the basement and not having an egress
window. The caregiver agreed to dismantle the bed and store the mattresses.
Photos were taken of the dismantle bed and the removal of the mattresses. The
photos are uploaded in CWLM with this safety alert.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
6/27/2023
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
6/28/23
________________________________________
Linda D Tansil Date
Area Manager
